meanings.definition: To flow in a continuous current.
meanings.sent1: The river streamed swiftly down the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The water streamed out of the faucet.
meanings.sent3: The ants streamed out of their nest in a long line.
meanings.sent4: Tears streamed down her face as she watched the sad movie.
meanings.sent5: The colorful fish streamed gracefully through the water.

meanings.definition: To transmit or receive data over the internet in real time.
meanings.sent1: I streamed my favorite show online last night.
meanings.sent2: We streamed the live concert on our devices.
meanings.sent3: The students streamed the lecture to their laptops.
meanings.sent4: The news streamed the breaking story to viewers around the world.
meanings.sent5: She streamed the video call to connect with her family overseas.

meanings.definition: To emit or discharge in a continuous flow.
meanings.sent1: Smoke streamed from the chimney of the cozy cabin.
meanings.sent2: The factory streamed pollutants into the air.
meanings.sent3: The aroma of freshly baked bread streamed from the bakery.
meanings.sent4: Music streamed from the open windows of the car.
meanings.sent5: The scent of flowers streamed through the garden on a gentle breeze.
